comments:
Seems that this bug is quite "unrealistic", but since I ran into it twice today
I'll better report it.

To reproduce:

- Create a new project (either Java project or Simple project will do)
- Create a new file in this project (or a new class if a Java project)
- Close all editor views (especially the one for this new file)
- Use your favourite file manager to delete the file outside Eclipse
- Open an editor to show that nonexisting file (editor with "Resource not found" will appear)
- Leave this editor open!
- Delete the project (does not matter if you keep or delete contents)
- Close Eclipse (and confirm to close)
- Error will show

Michael
I believe this is already fixed.  Please re-open if it happens in 3.2 M6.
